page.title: 06TOURISM
page.content: The east side of block 0324 0468 adjoins Morecambe Bay and is popular in the summer with day visitors from Barrow and Ulverston who find the area quiet and relaxed with pleasant views across Morecambe Bay.The area is not at all commercialised but there are two caravan sites at Newbiggin which cater for local people and for visitors from further afield.The caravan sites provide basic amenities such as toilets and running water and little else apart from a childrens' adventure playground.The sea is used for bathing but at low tide the sea is represented by a narrow channel nearly 2 k.m's from the coast and even at high tide the water is quite shallow.The coast is served by a good main "A" road with a two hourly 'bus service between Barrow and Ulverston.
